page.title: 15CULWORTH CUSTOMS-MANNERS
page.content: Polite observance of convention is important to families in the area.A survey by school children discovered that they are all being trained to behave in a similar manner.Elbows are not allowed on tables,it is considered rude.Generally guests at table are expected to wait until all are served . Most people expect younger members of a group to be polite,hold open doors,and give their seats to elderly relatives. Eating off a knife is forbidden and holding a fork the right way round is important,as is tipping a bowl away from the holder. It is important to say:PLEASE:, :THANK YOU:and:EXCUSE ME: in all the right places.When somebody sneezes the response is:BLESS YOU:.Greeting people with:GOOD MORNING:or:GOOD AFTERNOON:or just:HELLO:is polite.Speaking with a mouth full of food is definitely taboo.
